page.title: 07CHANGES IN LITTLE HORKESLEY
page.content: Mrs Gladys Leach moved to Little Horkesley in 1950 and in that 35 years has seen quite a few changes.She started working in 1950 at Lower Dairy House,owned by Mr&Mrs Warburton,as a cook.She earned Â£1.00 a week and got her keep. Farm workers still worked a long day in the 50's and Shire horses were used.Now farms are fully mechanised and only one or two men are needed to do the work. There was a grocery shop in Lt.Horkesley but a few years ago it was closed down,people have to shop in Colchester now.Bicycle were used a great deal for transport but now most people own cars.Norfolks,a local bus company,have run buses from Lt. Horkesley to Colchester for a number of years but now there is only one bus a day.
